Yes, it's possible that coaches will intentionally make surprise moves to throw off their opponents mentally, even if it doesn't necessarily give them a physical advantage on the court. Basketball is a highly strategic game, and sometimes psychological gamesmanship can provide an edge.

For example, a coach may choose to start a lineup that is completely different from their typical starters or draw up a completely different set of plays in order to give their opponents an unexpected look on the court. By doing this, they may hope to create confusion or uncertainty in the minds of their opponents, which can lead to mistakes and missed opportunities.

However, it's important to note that this tactic comes with risks. If the surprise move has a negative effect on the coach's own team, it can backfire and lead to a loss. Additionally, if the opponent is able to adjust mentally and stay focused despite the unexpected move, it may not provide the coach's team with a significant advantage.
